name: Universal Security Guard
description: User-scoped security hook that blocks universally dangerous operations like reverse shells, privilege escalation, and credential access across all projects.
longDescription: Intercepts Bash, Read, Write, and Edit calls globally across all projects. Blocks reverse shells (`/dev/tcp`, `netcat` exec, `socat` bridges), privilege escalation (`sudo`, `chmod` SUID/777), download-and-execute chains, encoding bypass to shell, library injection (`LD_PRELOAD`, `DYLD_INSERT_LIBRARIES`), persistence mechanisms (`crontab`, `launchctl`, `systemd`), `macOS` attacks (`osascript`, keychain access, Gatekeeper/SIP bypass), dangerous `git config` changes, credential file reads (SSH keys, cloud creds, browser passwords, crypto wallets, shell histories, Terraform state), system directory writes, container escapes, firewall and kernel manipulation, and fork bombs. Never auto-approves -- only denies threats and defers safe commands to the normal permission flow.
